ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Have you ever smoked a cigarette, even a puff?
How old were you the (first/last) time you smoked a cigarette? Age Onset:
How old were you the (first/last) time you smoked a cigarette? Age Recovery:
Have you ever used chewing tobacco?
Notes: 1 = No (Skip to Box TB1); 5 = Yes; 999 = Missing

ElementDescription: How old were you the (first/last) time you used chewing tobacco? Age Onset:
How old were you the (first/last) time you used chewing tobacco? Age Recovery:
Have you ever smoked a full cigarette?
How old were you the first time you smoked a full cigarette? Age Onset:
Over your lifetime, have you smoked a total of 100 cigarettes (smoked 5 or more packs)?
Over your lifetime, have you smoked a total of 20 cigarettes (smoked 1 pack or more)?
What is the largest number of cigarettes you've ever smoked in a single day?
When you were smoking regularly, how many days per week did you usually smoke cigarettes?
Notes: 999 = Missing. If not as often as once a week, code 0

ElementDescription: If DK, did you usually smoke at least 2 days per week?
How many cigarettes did you usually smoke in a day?
If DK, did you usually smoke at least 20 cigarettes in a day?
For about how long did you smoke this many cigarettes at that rate?
For about how long did you smoke this many cigarettes at that rate? Code Units
During this period when you were smoking the most, about how many cigarettes did you usually have per day?
If DK was it usually...
During this period when you were smoking the most, about how many minutes after you woke up did you smoke your first cigarette?
If DK, was it usually...
Notes: 1 = Within 5 minutes; 2 = Within 6-30 minutes; 3 = Within 31-60 minutes; 4 = More than one hour; 999 = Missing

ElementDescription: During this period when you were smoking the most, did you usually smoke more frequently during the first hours after waking than during the rest of the day?

During the period when you were smoking the most, did you usually find it difficult to keep from smoking in places where it was forbidden; for example, on airplanes, in church, at the library, in movie theaters, in "no smoking" sections of restaurants or office buildings, or perhaps in situations where someone asked you not to?
During the period when you were smoking the most, which cigarette would you have hated most to give up: the first one in the morning, after eating, while watching television, or some other one?
Notes: 1 = Any others; 5 = First one in morning; 999 = Missing

ElementDescription: During the period when you were smoking the most, were there times you smoked even when you were so ill that you had to be in bed most of the day?
Did you ever chain smoke; that is, where you smoked several cigarettes, one right after another?
How many hours in a row did you smoke like that?
If DK, did you ever smoke like that for 3 hours or more?
How many cigarettes did you smoke in a row?
If DK, was it at least 3 in a row?
What is the longest period of time you have chain smoked every day or nearly every day?
What is the longest period of time you have chain smoked every day or nearly every day? Code Units
Have you often wanted to quit or cut down on smoking?
Have you ever tried to quit smoking for at least 24 hours?
Have you ever tried to cut down, by about half, the number of cigarettes you smoked?
Notes: 1 = No (Skip to TB15); 5 = Yes (Skip to C); 999 = Missing

ElementDescription: How many times did you try to quit?
Were you always able to stop or cut down when you tried to?
Were you able to stop or cut down for at least 1 month?
Have you 3 or more times found that you were unable to stop or cut down on smoking (for at least 1 month)?

Since you began smoking regularly, what is the longest period of time you have gone without using any form of tobacco for any reason, like when you had an illness, or lost interest in tobacco, or intentionally quit?

Since you began smoking regularly, what is the longest period of time you have gone without using any form of tobacco for any reason, like when you had an illness, or lost interest in tobacco, or intentionally quit? Code Units
Have you ever attended a class or group for people trying to quit or reduce their use of tobacco?
Have you ever tried nicotine gum or a nicotine patch (to quit or reduce your use of tobacco)?
Have you ever tried nicotine-free cigarettes (to quit or reduce your use of tobacco)?
Have you tried any other form of treatment or medicine to quit or reduce your use of tobacco?
Specify the other form of treatment or medicine you have tried to quit or reduce your use of tobacco?

How old were you the (first/last) time you tried any of these methods to quit or cut down? Age Recovery:
Think about the time when you had the most problems when you went without cigarettes or had fewer than usual. Were you irritable, angry, or frustrated?
Think about the time when you had the most problems when you went without cigarettes or had fewer than usual. Were you nervous or anxious?
Think about the time when you had the most problems when you went without cigarettes or had fewer than usual. Were you restless?
Think about the time when you had the most problems when you went without cigarettes or had fewer than usual. Did you have trouble concentrating?
Think about the time when you had the most problems when you went without cigarettes or had fewer than usual. Did your heart slow down?
Think about the time when you had the most problems when you went without cigarettes or had fewer than usual. Did you feel down or depressed?

Think about the time when you had the most problems when you went without cigarettes or had fewer than usual. Did you have such a strong desire for cigarettes that you couldn't think of anything else?
Think about the time when you had the most problems when you went without cigarettes or had fewer than usual. Did your appetite increase or did you gain weight?
Think about the time when you had the most problems when you went without cigarettes or had fewer than usual. Did you have trouble sleeping?
Did the problems you had after quitting or cutting down on smoking often interfere with your work, school, or household responsibilities?
Did you start smoking again or use other sources of nicotine to avoid having the problems that quitting might cause?
